crazyballrun.game.graphics

Class Camera

  • java.lang.Object
    • crazyballrun.game.graphics.Camera

  • public class Camera
extends java.lang.Object
    The Camera-class has a position, field of view and a rectangle which specifies the display of the camera-content on the screen. The camera has a refernce to the level and is responsible for rendering just a part of the level (frustum culling).

        Creates a camera inside the given level.

        p - new camera position
        layer - layer where the camera is positioned

      • setLayer

        public void setLayer(int layer)
        Sets the current layer where the camera is positioned in the level.
        Parameters:
        layer - current layer of the camera

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(Vector2D p)
        Sets the position of the camera inside of the level (in textures).

        p - new camera position

      • getPosition

        public Vector2D getPosition()
        Gets the position of the camera (in textures).
        Returns:
        the camera position in the level.

      • getRenderPosition

        public Vector2D getRenderPosition()
        Calculates the render-position of the camera (including the display-offset of the camera).
        Returns:
        rendering-position of the camera

      • setDisplay

        public void setDisplay(int x,
              int y,
              int width,
              int height)
        Creates a display for the camera on the screen. The display shows what the camera tracks in the level (textures, objects, ...).
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate of the display position on the screen (in pixels)
        y - y-coordinate of the display position on the screen (in pixels)
        width - display width on the screen (in pixels)
        height - display height on the screen (in pixels)

      • getDisplay

        public java.awt.Rectangle getDisplay()
        Gets the display-area of the camera.
        Returns:
        camera's display

      • paint

        public void paint(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
         java.awt.Frame f,
         int timestep)
        Paints whatever is in the camera's field of view.
        Parameters:
        g - reference to the Graphics-instance
        f - reference to the Frame-instance
        timestep - passed miliseconds since the last rendered frame
